intro: Stachys scardica, commonly known as narrowleaf betony, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces spikes of violet to purple flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Stachys scardica is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional herbal medicine.
